evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The City of Grants Pass is trying to run homeless people out of town.

extracted.value: City of Grants Pass is trying to run homeless people out of town.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Hundreds of individuals in Grants Pass are forced to live outside due to the lack of emergency shelter and affordable housing.

extracted.value: Hundreds of individuals in Grants Pass are forced to live outside due to the lack of emergency shelter and affordable housing.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: City has refused to allow warming stations in winter and cooling stations in summer.

extracted.value: City has refused to allow warming stations in winter and cooling stations in summer.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: City has removed park benches from its parks.

extracted.value: City has removed park benches from its parks.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: City has paid one-way bus fare for homeless people to leave town.

extracted.value: City has paid one-way bus fare for homeless people to leave town.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Blake is involuntarily homeless and has been so for the past seven years.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake is involuntarily homeless for the past seven years.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Blake lost her job and her housing and has been forced to live outside.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake lost her job and housing about seven years ago.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Blake cannot afford housing and there is no available bed for her at an emergency shelter anywhere in Grants Pass.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake cannot afford housing and there is no available bed for her at an emergency shelter.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Blake, over the past seven years has been repeatedly told by Grants Pass police that she must “move along” and that there is nowhere in Grants Pass that she can legally sit or rest.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was repeatedly told by Grants Pass police to "move along" and told there is nowhere to sit or rest.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: She has been repeatedly awakened by Grants Pass police while sleeping and told that she needs to get up and move.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was awakened by Grants Pass police while sleeping and told to get up.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: She has been repeatedly told by Grants Pass police that she should leave town.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was told to leave town.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Because she has no choice but to live outside and has no place else to go, Ms. Blake has faced ticketing, fines and criminal prosecution.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake faced ticketing, fines, criminal prosecution.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On July 1, 2014, at 6:20 a.m., Ms. Blake was cited for violating GPMC 5.61.020 for sleeping in an alley at 620 SE J Street in Grants Pass and was fined $35. Ms. Blake is unable to pay this fine, which because of late fees is now $109.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was cited July 1, 2014 for sleeping in alley at 620 SE J Street; fined $35 (now $109).

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On September 24, 2014 at 3:26 a.m., Ms. Blake was cited for violating GPMC 5.61.030 for “prohibited camping” while sleeping at 311SE G Street in Grants Pass and was fined $295. Ms. Blake is unable to pay this fine, which because of late fees is now $503.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was cited September 24, 2014 for prohibited camping at 311 SE G Street; fined $295 (now $503).

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On October 4, 2014, Ms. Blake was cited for violating GPMC 5.61.030 for “prohibited camping” while sleeping at 431 NE D Street in Grants Pass and was fined $295. Ms. Blake is unable to pay this fine, which because of late fees is now $503.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was cited October 4, 2014 for prohibited camping at 431 NE D Street; fined $295 (now $503).

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On October 28, 2015, Ms. Blake was sleeping at 1555 NE A Street in Grants Pass and was arrested and charged with Criminal Trespass in the First Degree, under ORS 164.255, a Class A Misdemeanor. Ms. Blake was convicted, fined $200 and placed on bench probation for 24 months.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was arrested October 28, 2015 sleeping at 1555 NE A Street; charged with Criminal Trespass in First Degree; convicted, fined $200, bench probation 24 months (now $416).

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On May 1, 2016, Ms. Blake was sleeping on private property located at 201 NE 8th Street in Grants Pass and was arrested and charged with Criminal Trespass in the Second Degree under ORS 164.245, a Class C Misdemeanor. She was convicted, fined $200 and placed on bench probation for six months.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was arrested May 1, 2016 sleeping on private property at 201 NE 8th Street; charged with Criminal Trespass in Second Degree; convicted, fined $200, bench probation 6 months (now $416).

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On July 17, 2018, Ms. Blake was sleeping in Riverside Park in Grants Pass at 7:33 a.m. She was approached by a Grants Pass police officer and issued a citation for violating GPMC 6.46.090 “Camping in Park” a violation that has a presumptive fine of $295.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was cited July 17, 2018 for Camping in Park at Riverside Park; fine $295 (now $410).

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On July 24, 2018, Ms. Blake was again in Riverside Park. She was arrested, taken into custody, cited for Criminal Trespass II, incarcerated and spent the night in jail before being released the next morning. Her release agreement contains the provision that Ms. Blake is to “have no contact with All Grants Pass Parks.” The Criminal Trespass II citation has yet to be charged. She was found guilty of the “Camping in Park” offense and her fine for this offense is now $410.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake was arrested July 24, 2018 in Riverside Park; taken into custody; cited for Criminal Trespass II; incarcerated; release agreement prohibits contact with all Grants Pass Parks; fine now $410.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Blake now owes the City of Grants Pass more than $4000 in fines for crimes and violations related directly to her involuntary homelessness and the fact that there is no affordable housing or emergency shelter in Grants Pass where Ms. Blake can stay.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake owes City more than $4000 in fines for crimes and violations related to homelessness.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Ms. Blake continues to live without shelter in Grants Pass. At any time, she could be arrested, ticketed and prosecuted for sleeping outside or for covering herself with a blanket to stay warm. She has no place else to go.

extracted.value: Ms. Blake continues to live without shelter; could be arrested, ticketed, prosecuted for sleeping outside or covering herself with a blanket.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Grant Pass has no Public Housing and the wait list for a Section 8 voucher is long.

extracted.value: City has no public housing.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: There is no place to use the voucher; ... if a person gets one, there are very few places to use it.

extracted.value: City has no emergency shelter.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: If a person is lucky enough to get a voucher in Josephine County there is only a 22% utilization rate.

extracted.value: City has a long wait list for a Section 8 voucher; only 22% utilization.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The City has built fences around bus stop benches.

extracted.value: City built fences around bus stop benches.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The City has made it impossible for any organization to operate a warming or cooling center for homeless people anywhere within the City.

extracted.value: City made it impossible for any organization to operate a warming or cooling center.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The Grants Pass City Council has voted against affordable housing projects being allowed in the City.

extracted.value: City council voted against affordable housing projects.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The City Council has voted against affordable housing projects being allowed in the City, sometimes citing non-existent problems, like lack of parking, to explain their votes against affordable housing.

extracted.value: City council cited lack of parking to vote against affordable housing.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Elected officials have publicly stated their desire to drive homeless people from the City and to make it difficult for homeless people to live in Grants Pass.

extracted.value: City officials want to drive homeless out of city.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Commissioners declared a countywide affordable housing crisis in November of 2017.

extracted.value: Commissioners declared a countywide affordable housing crisis in November 2017.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: County took steps to legalize more nonconventional housing units and camping in some circumstances.

extracted.value: County took steps to legalize more nonconventional housing units and camping in some circumstances.

evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: The Mayor of Grants Pass, Darin Fowler, publicly expressed opposition to these measures.

extracted.value: Mayor of Grants Pass publicly expressed opposition to these measures.
